full_text: The Honorable Alison J. Nathan April 30, 2021 Page 2 Accordingly, we respectfully request that the Court issue an order directing the MDC to accept the master hard drives either from defense counsel or from the government. We will send a copy of this letter to the MDC Legal Department so that they can note any objections they may have. Thank you for your attention to this matter. Sincerely, /s/ Christian Everdell Christian R. Everdell COHEN & GRESSER LLP 800 Third Avenue, 21st Floor New York, New York 10022 (212) 957-7600 cc: All Counsel of Record (By ECF) MDC Legal Department

text_blocks.content: The Honorable Alison J. Nathan April 30, 2021 Page 2

Accordingly, we respectfully request that the Court issue an order directing the MDC to accept the master hard drives either from defense counsel or from the government. We will send a copy of this letter to the MDC Legal Department so that they can note any objections they may have.
Thank you for your attention to this matter.
Christian R. Everdell COHEN & GRESSER LLP 800 Third Avenue, 21st Floor New York, New York 10022 (212) 957-7600
cc: All Counsel of Record (By ECF) MDC Legal Department

additional_notes: The document appears to be a formal letter from a law firm to a judge, discussing a legal matter and requesting a court order. The document is well-formatted and legible.
